page.title: 17Changing Times.School 1920's
page.content: Mr Sprot went to Lucker School because it was a shorter walk from Adderstone Mains.These small country schools have all closed and the children are now transported into Belford.He started school at the age of 5 and left aged 14 to work at Adderstone Farm with the "odd" horse (a horse working alone rather than in a pair).There were 2 classes,the first for children up to the age of 8.The teacher used a leather belt to keep order and the children had to sit at their desks working during classtime.The toilets were outside.There were no school lunches.He carried sandwiches and tea in a tin bottle which he warmed at lunchtime by putting it next to a hot stove.The children wrote with ink. There were no toys,computers, televisions or radios as we have in school today.
